meanings.definition: A person who dissects bodies for anatomical study.
meanings.sent1: The prosector carefully examined the body to learn about its structure.
meanings.sent2: The prosector at the university lab is skilled at dissecting cadavers.
meanings.sent3: The prosector joked that they have a 'cutting-edge' job in the medical field.
meanings.sent4: The prosector's precision in dissecting bodies is like a surgeon's skill in the operating room.
meanings.sent5: Watching the prosector dissect the body made me appreciate the complexity of human anatomy.

meanings.definition: To dissect a body for anatomical study.
meanings.sent1: The students prosector the frog in biology class to learn about its organs.
meanings.sent2: She will prosector the specimen carefully to avoid damaging any vital structures.
meanings.sent3: The scientist decided to prosector the fruit to see its internal structure.
meanings.sent4: He had to prosector the puzzle to understand how all the pieces fit together.
meanings.sent5: The chef needed to prosector the fish to remove the bones before cooking.
